subject: Automobile Racing
lead_paragraph: Kimi Raikkonen comfortably won the Malaysian Grand Prix in Sepang on Sunday, immediately injecting Ferrari into the title race. Raikkonen won by 20 seconds over BMW Sauber’s Robert Kubica, with McLaren’s Heikki Kovalainen another 19 seconds back in third. The only negative for Ferrari was the failure by the pole-sitter, Felipe Massa, to finish. After winning in Australia last week, Lewis Hamilton finished fifth after starting in ninth as a result of a five-grid-place penalty for causing interference in qualifying.
